title: No Money, Mo' Problems: Murphy's Budget Proposal
description: The New Jersey state legislature was quite productive in late March so we go over some of the legislation being passed and being considered in Trenton. We go over the six gun laws passed in the State Assembly, some great pieces of legislation that came out of a Senate Committee that are focused on voting reforms, and the 'strongest equal pay law' that passed in both houses of the state legislature. We also have some quick 2018 election updates and we finish the episode with an interesting interview with one of the Democratic primary candidates in NJ's 7th Congressional District: Goutam Jois.

sourceLinks.linkHeadline: Lawmakers just voted to make N.J. gun laws even tougher
Hundreds decry N.J. 'feeding frenzy' on gun rights in protest before votes today

title: No Money, Mo' Problems: Murphy's Budget Proposal
description: NJ Governor and Michael Keaton stunt double Phil Murphy unveiled his first budget proposal last week and we take a lot of time to go over it and provide our thoughts on what it will mean for the state of New Jersey as well as possible roadblocks for Murphy's agenda. We also cover updates on the Jersey City teachers' strike and marijuana legislation that was introduced to the State Assembly last week. We end with some quick 2018 Congressional race updates.

sourceLinks.linkHeadline: New Jersey school walkouts: Full Coverage
10 things you absolutely need to know about Murphy budget's tax increases and spending
Jersey City's 4,000-member teachers union strikes for first time since 1998
A new legal weed plan allows for hundreds of dispensaries across N.J.
Decriminalizing weed instead of legalizing it won't happen, N.J. Senate president says
How Menendez is doing against Republican opponent in first poll since his trial ended
Another Democrat drops out of race for Leonard Lance's seat
Joe Biden Endorses New Jersey Congressional Candidate Andy Kim

title: Voting rights, teacher's strike, Bob Hugin, and more
description: In this week's episode, it's just Jay and Brian and they talk about a variety of stories this week: a possible Jersey City teacher's strike coming soon, a poll on New Jerseyans and their views on some tax policies, Senator Bob Menendez's 2018 opponent, felony disenfranchisement, an EPA pick by Trump, the powerful storms in NJ and power outages, and we finish with some news on the 2018 election for the 3rd congressional district of New Jersey.

sourceLinks.linkHeadline: Jersey City teachers take step toward first strike since 1998
Tax legal weed? Raise taxes on millionaires? What N.J. residents think about Murphy plans
Is Menendez's Republican challenger even more ethically challenged? | Editorial
1 ancient law is stopping thousands of people from voting | Editorial
Trump's latest EPA pick works for company linked to NJ Superfund site
Phil Murphy orders investigation of N.J. power companies' response to nor'easters
N.J. congressman who backed Trump tax bill gets more outside help

title: Dirty DuPont, Millionaire's tax, Gateway Tunnel, and drilling
description: This week's episode is particularly special because we have a new host! We welcome Brian Karabinchak as a regular co-host on Parkway Politics. That should be enough reason to tune in but if not, we also talk about a story that The Record and northjersey.com broke about toxic waste from an old DuPont plant. After that, we dig in to further developments on the millionaire's tax, offshore drilling pushed by the federal Interior Department, and some political malevolence from Trump regarding the Gateway Tunnel project.

sourceLinks.linkHeadline: Toxic Secrets: Pollution, evasion and fear in North Jersey
Murphy will still push millionaires tax, setting up possible showdown with top Democrat
Trump trying to block funding for Gateway Tunnel project
NJ might get bumped off Trump offshore drilling plans
Menendez just lost his Democratic primary opponent

title: Marijuana Update, Murphy's First Bill, and Guns
description: We discuss the proposed legislation on gun control in New Jersey and its potential impact on gun violence. We also touch on a proposed compromise on legalizing marijuana, Phil Murphy's first law regarding funding for women's health services, and end with some news regarding the 2nd Congressional District in NJ and its implications for 2018.

sourceLinks.linkHeadline: Phil Murphy joins with other Democratic governors to push gun control
Murphy assures parents and vows stricter N.J. gun control after Florida school shooting
Legal marijuana foes offer a compromise: Decriminalize it
Phil Murphy cheered as he signs his first bill into law
Is this Democrat tacking to the left as he runs for Republican-held House seat?
LoBiondo on leaving Congress: 'At a certain point it's got to end'

title: Bobby H
description: This week, we're a little less New Jersey focused because we wanted to talk about the unfortunate (and-avoidable-if-Republicans-grew-a-spine-and-passed-gun-legislation) shooting in Florida. We discuss the NRA and its influence and also touch on Senator Menendez's re-election fight coming up in 2018.

sourceLinks.linkHeadline: Here's How Much the NRA Has Given to Florida Lawmakers

H.R. 38: Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act of 2017

title: loop-around
description: This week, we discuss Phil Murphy and his legislative agenda including the marijuana legalization effort which is now running into hurdles in the NJ legislature. We also go over some 2018 races for Congress.

title: Sour Patch Kids for All
description: We discuss the upcoming races in New Jersey and give our take on the outlook for the Democratic party in November 2018. Then we go over the basics of the new tax law and how it impacts New Jersey.

title: Promo
